intro: Guajava sericea, commonly known as silky guajava, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. The fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to red when mature.
